newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Straits to buy Singapore coal firm.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Straits to buy Singapore coal firm.

text.p: Gold and copper miner Straits Resources Ltd said on Wednesday it had agreed to buy Singapore's Straits Sebuku Pte Ltd for US$20.6 million.
Straits Sebuku owns large coal interests in Indonesia, the company said.

"On completion, the acquisition will provide Straits Resources with an 80 percent interest in the Sebuku Coal Project expected to generate in excess of A$100 million cashflow over its 11 year life," Straits Resources Ltd said.
"It will also provide Straits with a 64 percent interest in the Sungei Durian Coal Exploration Project which has potential to yield large tonnage high quality thermal coal resources," Straits said.
"The acquisition price of US$20.6 million will be funded in cash (US$10.6 million) from the company's reserves plus 7.91 million Straits Resources shares at A$1.60 per share."
He said a feasibility study of Sebuku had defined coal resources of 18.7 million tonnes and mineable in-situ reserves of 15.5 million tonnes of thermal coal.
Product quality would average 0.9 percent sulphur, 8.5 percent to 9.5 percent ash and 5,910 to 5,975 kilocalories per kg.
"This is similar to the better Mahakam River coals, readily sold to industrial and power generation markets in Asia," Rear said.
"Mine life, at an annual production rate of 1.35 million tonnes, is estimated at 11 years."
